alert.note: Alert for Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 11:11PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ulster County through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1110 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grahamsville, or 12 miles northwest of Ellenville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads. Locations impacted include... Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Olivebridge, Denning, Ashokan, Cherrytown, Samsonville, Palentown, Sundown, Oliverea, Pacama, Brodhead, Liebhardt, Woodland, Branch, Greenfield Park, Boiceville, Frost Valley, Lackawack and Peekamoose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized ponding of water.
